moves.7. Nf3: Blocking any attack on f2 for good.
moves.7... Nc6 8. Nbd2: All of our pieces are focused towards the kingside.
moves.9. h3: Blocking all potential moves for the knight except back...
moves.9... Ne5: Here is where things started to get crazy.
moves.10... dxe5 11. O-O Bd6 12. Qa4+: I abandon my king and start my conquest.
moves.12... Bd7 13. Qb3 Qg6 14. Qxb7: Full marks for bravery, maybe not for smarts.
moves.14... O-O 15. Kh1: I get out of the pin. Kh2 didn't look appealing after Ng4+.
moves.17. Qe3: In a attack there is a time when you have to pull back and reorganize.
moves.18. a4: I start pushing my passed pawn.
moves.18... Qh5: This would be deadly if it wasn't for...
moves.19. Nh2: !! The ultimate defense. I am secure from all threats.
moves.20. a5: In my following turns whenever I get a tempo, I push the pawn.
moves.20... Bg5 21. Qf3: Notice how his queen is hanging and mine can be recaptured with my hanging knight.
moves.21... Qg6 22. Nc4: Or I could have sacrificed my knight and pushed the pawn. My bishop would be freed and it could chase down the rook.
moves.25... Rfd8 26. Bc2 Bb5 27. Na3: He can't take my pawn because of Nxb5 and then the rooks are traded.
moves.27... Bc6 28. Nc4 Qg5 29. Na5: I start to challenge the passed pawn attackers.
moves.31... Bc6 32. Bd5 Bxd5: The only move. Letting the bishop live loses the rook on a8.
moves.35... Qf6 36. Nxd6 cxd6 37. c4: Threatening to undermine the d-pawn and then advancing the d-pawn.
moves.41. Nxe5: Looking back I am not sure if my sac is correct.
moves.45... Ra6 46. c5 dxc5 47. Rxc5 g5 48. Rc: Can't move to the sixth rank thanks to a fork.
moves.49. Rxh7 g4: Hoping for hxg4, Nxg4 followed by Ra1#
moves.50. d6 g3 51. d7+: I push it with check before...
moves.53. Nxd6: Black was lost anyway. He resigned.
